replies.body:
Doublelift dies to Red buff in LCS, next patch Red buff gets nerfed.

Coincidence? I think NOT!

Rest in peace, Galio.

And welcome, new champion that is coincidentally also named Galio!

Just so we're clear on what is happening here.

YES, that is exactly what they did!!! poor gargoyle {{champion:3}} they called him a Rainspout :(
I will miss him, not sure how much I will like playing as the White Ranger . . . er. . . new Galio
Isn't that what they do with most champion reworks? The only things the same about champs like Yorick and Warwick are their core themes and ideas. Almost everything else changed.

That right there is exactly the problem, at least in my eyes.  Not only was his gameplay drastically (_completely_, I'd say) changed, his entire character has been erased and replaced with something completely different.  The core ideas and themes of Galeo, the Sentinel's Sorrow are no longer there.  And, frankly, I can only see it as one more case of Riot's complete disregard for their old lore.

(Side-note disclaimer: No, I don't play Galeo.  Yes, I am a fan of the pre-Great-Retcon lore.  No, I have no problems with this new character other than that Riot deleted a completely functional character to create him.)

It's funny how most of the comments on new patches nowadays receive primarily negative feedback.  There used to be a time where ANY negative comment used to be down-voted into oblivion just because Riot was infallible. But Riot's been out of sync with their gamers for a while now.  

My theory as to why: There's no consistency to the game anymore.  It makes it frustrating for long time gamers who don't want to have to re-learn the game, or find a new main, every few months.  

For me I finally lost interest when they nerfed Anivia's R>E combo a while back (my long time main). Anivia was considered to be fine for like 5 years, and then all of a sudden she's randomly considered OP, and a staple of her gameplay was deleted. Now she's just frankly not fun to play anymore. 

I feel for all the other characters which have been through the same thing. But I've already moved on, I only logged on to see if URF was coming back.

>{{champion:133}} After putting at least one point in Behind Enemy Lines, Quinn respawns as Valor after deaths for the rest of the game

Please explain, Im too dumb

Quinn won't have to activate her ultimate in the fountain.

This won't actually change anything for Quinn players aside from being a little more convenient.  There is no reason they wouldn't activate their ultimate in the fountain after respawning anyways.

> [{quoted}](name=EndlessSorcerer,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=1KoEM2pA,comment-id=00050001,timestamp=2017-03-21T18:19:37.382+0000)
>
> Quinn won't have to activate her ultimate in the fountain.
> 
> This won't actually change anything for Quinn players aside from being a little more convenient.  There is no reason they wouldn't activate their ultimate in the fountain after respawning anyways.

It's a beautiful QoL change! I play Quinn occasionally, so when I respawn I sometimes forget to use my ultimate. This is so helpful.
As Quinn main, can confirm, I ult as soon as I respawn/back
Quinn spawns as Valor after dying so she doesn't have to spend the mana and time to cast ult to get to lane faster.
STOP NERFING VARUS

this is a buff, dear child. his 4 sec reduction on q used to be LESS reduction if you had MORE cdr, now it is flat 4 seconds no matter your cdr.

edit: a buff to the previous nerf (longer cd with refund on blight pop)
Surprised that there are no upset comments about URF not being on April 1st

Not that surprising. People are starting to learn that Riot really only cares about Rift and everything else is a tacked on afterthought. The game mode rotation for the last couple of months has been nothing but a slog of low popularity/overused game modes with the exception of AR URF which most people dislike in place of normal URF. Ultimately, Riot will do what they do with Howling Abyss/Tristed Treeline. Half-ass it until people stop talking about it or they decide to get rid of it.
Kind of makes me think about my summoner icon, what is Dominion again?

{{champion:96}} <- now officially a puppy.
This is fine.
Agreed. If I didn't already have Battlecast, I would buy it. I still might tbh. I've been known to do that with certain champions...

Just thought I'd leave a quick comment- Ahri's W is NOT charm, her E is her charm while W is foxfire!
It's a mistake in the bugfixes!
ha!  they also listed Viktor's bugfix twice.
You forgot to mention that Kassadin has a magic damage shield on his Q. Nice try Riot, I'm, not forgetting all those years of 95% ban rate THAT easily.

darn i wanted Urf since it was almost april fools i hated arurf it wasnt random at all and it was cancer.
Reasons why:
1. No mirror matches
2. a lot of the free to play champs were picked often
3. i had to play yasuo in urf
4. i had to play vs Fiora/Xin/Wu/Eve/Shaco/Fizz/Maokai, when in normal urf i could have ban them.
5. theres a reason why we had bans cause the OP urf champs were still AVAILABLE and they were banned for a REASON
6. unbalanced teams ex. blue team 3 op pick 2 decent picks red team 1 op pick 4 ok picks
7. not all of us are tryhards, i would like to pick the same champ and try different builds with them, like lethality on jinx, Ap Ashe, etc.
8. playing a very weak urf champ against your will (dont say that "all champs are op u just have to learn them" bs, its urf i wanna have fun not learn a champ)
8. more bans could have fixed the whole urf issue :/, it would remove all the stale picks leaving room for the underrated champs. 
Rito u already tested random now give us more bans! 
and to counter your argument about "arurf and aram are the same thing"
at least in aram u dont have infinite mana and a karthus ulting every 35 seconds.
also i have uberdanger and Magikarpusedfly to agree with me
"should you play Urf? Yes! should you play Arurf? No" -Uber
"i just hate that i can;t choose who i wanna play on urf anymore i mean wtf man, that was the coolest thing about urf, finding and testing out champions that you think would be fun" - Magikarpusedfly
also my friend only got to play her favorite champion once this arurf, and this just isnt what urf is about, plz rito give us normal urf back.

Yeah I really don't have that much interest in playing AR Urf. I hate getting into games with super unbalanced teams and I enjoyed normal Urf being able to just pick the kind of BS that I got to play that game instead of getting forced to pick something that may just be really weak and not even having fun on it.

I probably logged as much time in ARURF as normal URF but not because I enjoyed it as much, it was because I was desperate to play at least 1 game with my mains. And almost everything in-between was miserable playing for me.
"Ahri's W-Charm." And several Ahri mains became tilted
i love how the croma skins of Meowkai, Amumu and Alistar do not only change the color like the one for Gnar, but also the faces/cake dekoration :D

Oh wow im having so much fun! 
Rito: Fun? oh we can't be having that in our game. *changes something without communities approval*
Community: Y tho?
Which change(s) are you referring to?
1. They nerfed Irelia.
Better nerf Irelia
and not a single bugfix to mordekaiser is riot waiting to release a reworked mordekaiser?
Yeah, when you see even a pro missing CS due to bugs, imagine how it is for us scrubs.

The probability might be higher than we all think. After Urgot, has Riot stated who the next VGU will be? It's definitely not a secret that Mordekaiser and Swain are both heavily outdated, so I expect they aim to redo Morde rather than trying to fix 20+ bugs.
Eve is after Urgot. Don't know who is after that though.
I wanted One for All >:V
same, I wanted a One for All with 5 Alistars donking the enemy into submission.

Too many crappy rotating modes. Feels like you gotta wait 2-3 months every time for a fun one. 

Would be interesting to see what the numbers look like in terms of how many people actually play each one...

I like nexus siege. Some people love URF. I can't stand it, and that's fine. Repeating modes a lot makes people get sick of them. Having them on all the time rather than just the weekend can negatively impact queue times. There's nothing wrong with variety, and Riot does have reasons for most of its decisions.

I agree it'd be interesting to see the data on popularity, though.
lol so why is ascension and that snow mode repeated so much but i have to sacrifice my 1st born for One for all and just look at pictures of urf while looking at arurf that comes once or twice a year

Ascension, Poro King and Nexus Siege have been out a combined 28 weekends. 

URF, ARURF, One for All, Nemesis Draft and Hunt of the Blood Moon have been out 14 weekends combined. 

That's pretty pathetic.

For those of you keeping track at home here is the RGM dates and how many of each mode we have seen so far.

RGM Dates

2016

4/8  Ascension
4/15 Legend of the Poro King
4/22 Urf (Ultra Rapid Fire)
4/29 Hexakill -Twisted Treeline
5/6  One For All
5/13 Ascension
5/20 Urf (Ultra Rapid Fire)
5/27 Definitely Not Dominion
6/3  Legend of the Poro King
6/10 Hexakill - Twisted Treeline
6/17 One For All
6/24 Ascension
7/1  Hexakill - Twisted Treeline
7/8  Definitely Not Dominion
7/15 Nexus Siege
7/22 Nexus Siege
7/29 Legend of the Poro King
8/5  One For All
8/12 Ascension
8/19 Nemesis Draft
8/26 Hexakill - Twisted Treeline
9/2  Nexus Siege
9/9  Legend of the Poro King
9/16 One For All
9/23 All Random Urf
9/30 Ascension
10/7 Definetly Not Dominion
10/14 Hexakill - Twisted Treeline
10/20 Doom Bots of Doom
10/28 Doom Bots of Doom
11/4 Legend of the Poro King
11/11 Ascension
11/18 Ascension
11/25 One For All
12/2 One For All
12/9 Nexus Seige
12/14 Legend of the Poro King
12/23 Legend of the Poro King
12/30 Legend of the poro King

2017

1/6 Legend of the Poro King
1/13 Ascension
1/20 Ascension
1/27 Nexus Siege
2/3 Nexus Siege
2/10 Hunt of the Blood Moon
2/17 Hunt of the Blood Moon
2/24 All Random Urf
3/3 All Random Urf
3/10 Ascension
3/17 Ascension
3/24 Nexus Seige
3/31 Nexus Seige

Totals:

 2 = Urf (Ultra Rapid Fire)
 3 = All Random Urf
 11 = Ascension
 9 = Legend of the Poro King
 5 = Hexakill - Twisted Treeline 
 6 = One For All
 3 = Definitely Not Dominion
 8 = Nexus Siege
 1 = Nemesis Draft
 2 = Doom Bots of Doom
 2 = Hunt of the Blood Moon

So the 3 worst are the most common? It's almost like they're forcing the AIDS down our throats, trying to beat us into liking Siege or Poro King. 

Riot needs to understand that outside of Hexakill, URF, and One For All, there just isn't replayability. Nexus Siege is cool for 1-2 games, but then I don't want to see it again for 6-12 months. Stop rolling out these monotonous game modes so often.
Why do you still use the assasin update splash above the patch notes?
They did the same kind of thing for the season 6 patch notes. Think of it as the "Season 7 Splash."

She’s now got about four times as much to say

Jhin is pleased by the perfection....
Pretty sure {{champion:103}} W isn't Charm but close enough.

Checked to see if its been mentioned on the list of bugs on Reddit or if it's been asked in Help and Support on the boards. If it hasn't been asked in Help and Support, feel free to ask. You'll more likely to get a direct response that way than hoping a Rioter involved with bug fixes finds this comment.

Personally, I think the "rotating game mode" section should show what the mode is more prominently. Maybe a bold title, in the same way that "Red Brambleback" has it. Mainly because if you're just skimming that section just to see what the mode is, since you already know how to play most/all modes, it takes a while to actually find it.
